instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message:
green light, fan spin, but no post:
no light on usb mouse, can charge battery.



<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.56V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.56V

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.5V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.49V

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.31V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 5V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.1V

<SIGNAL>P5V_S0_CPUIMVP_VDD</SIGNAL> 4.9V

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.3v

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> =
pin1 3.3v
pin2 0.5v
pin40 5.0v
pin24 5.0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: All voltages you need are present. Clean corrosion and I suspect crap under SMC too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: changed smc, tried a bios from donor board and its still same. any other suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: Clock chip and a thorough inspection for corrosion

threads.message: is there a way to test the clock chip without a oscilloscope ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message:
changed clock chip and Y2805 still same.

clock chip
pin1 3,3v
pin2 3.3v
pin11 1.8v
pin12 3.3v
pin13 3.49v

the front white led always on, does this mean anything?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: Inspect better for corrosion, there is not much else to do.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message:
the front white led always on, does this mean anything?


<CHIP>U4100</CHIP> area is corroded but its only firmwire stuff.

i've tried ultrasonic the board but still no good.

should i give up

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: Crap under Firewire chip will screw things up....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: i removed the fw chip, still no good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message:
Just to be sure, have you placed back the original BIOS chip after trying out one from a donor?

I think if you're in bad luck the ME area can differ enough to actually prevent the system from passing POST

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message:
yes, was placed back to the original after didn't work..

can the fw chip kill the smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged, fan spin but no chime, no display
threads.message: No it can't. It is corrosion somewhere and I cannot help with that unless I can see the board myself. I'm afraid this board has reached donor status now.
